intro: Sirmuellera sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-fruited sirmuellera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth and bears small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. Its fruit is a spherical capsule, giving it the common name "globe-fruited." The species is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or well-drained soils.
